00072 typedef unsigned long spl_t;
00073 
00074 #define splhigh(x)  rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00075 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00076 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore((x) & 1)
00077 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00078 #define splexit(x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00079 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00080 #define splnone()   rthal_sti()
00081 #define spltest()   rthal_local_irq_test()
00082 #define splget(x)   rthal_local_irq_flags(x)
00083 #define splsync(x)  rthal_local_irq_sync(x)

00085 typedef unsigned long xnlock_t;
00086 
00087 #define XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED 0
00088 
00089 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00090 
00091 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)  ((x) = __xnlock_get_irqsave(lock))
00092 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)   xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,1)
00093 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)    xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,0)
00094 
00095 static inline void xnlock_init (xnlock_t *lock) {
00096 
00097     *lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00098 }
00099 
00100 static inline spl_t __xnlock_get_irqsave (xnlock_t *lock)
00101 
00102 {
00103     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00104     spl_t flags;
00105 
00106     rthal_local_irq_save(flags);
00107 
00108     adeos_load_cpuid();
00109 
00110     if (!test_and_set_bit(cpuid,lock))
00111         {
00112         while (test_and_set_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock))
00113             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid);
00114         }
00115     else
00116         flags |= 2;
00117 
00118     return flags;
00119 }
00120 
00121 static inline void xnlock_put_irqrestore (xnlock_t *lock, spl_t flags)
00122 
00123 {
00124     if (!(flags & 2))
00125         {
00126         adeos_declare_cpuid;
00127 
00128         rthal_cli();
00129 
00130         adeos_load_cpuid();
00131 
00132         if (test_bit(cpuid,lock))
00133             {
00134             clear_bit(cpuid,lock);
00135             clear_bit(BITS_PER_LONG - 1,lock);
00136             rthal_cpu_relax(cpuid); /* FIXME: is this really needed ? */
00137             }
00138         }
00139 
00140     rthal_local_irq_restore(flags & 1);
00141 }
00142 
00143 #define XNARCH_PASSTHROUGH_IRQS /*empty*/
00144 
00145 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00146 
00147 #define xnlock_init(lock)              do { } while(0)
00148 #define xnlock_get_irqsave(lock,x)     rthal_local_irq_save(x)
00149 #define xnlock_put_irqrestore(lock,x)  rthal_local_irq_restore(x)
00150 #define xnlock_clear_irqoff(lock)      rthal_cli()
00151 #define xnlock_clear_irqon(lock)       rthal_sti()
00152 
00153 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */

00155 #define XNARCH_NR_CPUS               RTHAL_NR_CPUS
00156 
00157 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00158 #define XNARCH_IRQ_MAX               IPIPE_NR_XIRQS /* Do _not_ use NR_IRQS here. */
00159 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00160 /* Using 2/3 of the average jitter is some constant obtained from
00161    experimentation that proved to fit on tested PPC platforms with
00162    respect to auto-calibration. In any case, a more accurate
00163    scheduling latency can still be fixed by setting
00164    CONFIG_RTAI_HW_SCHED_LATENCY properly. */
00165 #define xnarch_adjust_calibration(x) ((x) * 2 / 3)

00206 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00207 
00208     /* Kernel mode side */
00209 
00210 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00211     /* We only care for basic FPU handling in kernel-space; Altivec
00212        and SPE are not available to kernel-based Xenomai threads. */
00213     rthal_fpenv_t fpuenv  __attribute__ ((aligned (16)));
00214     rthal_fpenv_t *fpup;        /* Pointer to the FPU backup area */
00215 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00216 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00217 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     NULL
00218 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00219 
00220     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00221     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00222     unsigned long ksp;          /* Saved KSP for kernel-based threads */
00223     unsigned long *kspp;        /* Pointer to saved KSP (&ksp or &user->thread.ksp) */
00224 
00225     /* User mode side */
00226     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00227     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00228 
00229     /* Init block */
00230     struct xnthread *self;
00231     int imask;
00232     const char *name;
00233     void (*entry)(void *cookie);
00234     void *cookie;
00235 
00236 } xnarchtcb_t;
00237

00248 typedef struct xnarch_heapcb {
00249 
00250     atomic_t numaps;    /* # of active user-space mappings. */
00251 
00252     int kmflags;        /* Kernel memory flags (0 if vmalloc()). */
00253 
00254     void *heapbase;     /* Shared heap memory base (possibly unaligned). */
00255 
00256     void *shmbase;      /* Shared memory base (page-aligned). */
00257 
00258 } xnarch_heapcb_t;

00260 static inline void xnarch_init_heapcb (xnarch_heapcb_t *hcb)
00261 
00262 {
00263     atomic_set(&hcb->numaps,0);
00264     hcb->kmflags = 0;
00265     hcb->heapbase = NULL;
00266     hcb->shmbase = NULL;
00267 }

00273 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_tsc_to_ns (unsigned long long ts) {
00274     return xnarch_llimd(ts,1000000000,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ);
00275 }
00276 
00277 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_ns_to_tsc (unsigned long long ns) {
00278     return xnarch_llimd(ns,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ,1000000000);
00279 }
00280 
00281 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_time (void) {
00282     return xnarch_tsc_to_ns(xnarch_get_cpu_tsc());
00283 }
00284 
00285 static inline unsigned long long xnarch_get_cpu_freq (void) {
00286     return RTHAL_CPU_FREQ;
00287 }

00289 static inline unsigned xnarch_current_cpu (void) {
00290     return adeos_processor_id();
00291 }
00292 
00293 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00294 
00295 {
00296     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00297         return vmalloc(bytes);
00298 
00299     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00300 }
00301 
00302 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00303 
00304 {
00305     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00306         vfree(chunk);
00307     else
00308         kfree(chunk);
00309 }

00313 #define xnarch_put_cpu(flags) adeos_put_cpu(flags)

00315 #define xnarch_halt(emsg) \
00316 do { \
00317     adeos_set_printk_sync(adp_current); \
00318     xnarch_logerr("fatal: %s\n",emsg); \
00319     show_stack(NULL,NULL);              \
00320     for (;;) ;                          \
00321 } while(0)

00324 #define xnarch_free_stack  xnfree

00326 static inline int xnarch_setimask (int imask)
00327 
00328 {
00329     spl_t s;
00330     splhigh(s);
00331     splexit(!!imask);
00332     return !!s;
00333 }

00337 static inline int xnarch_hook_irq (unsigned irq,
00338                                    void (*handler)(unsigned irq,
00339                                                    void *cookie),
00340                                    void *cookie)
00341 {
00342     int err = rthal_request_irq(irq,handler,cookie);
00343 
00344     if (!err)
00345         rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00346 
00347     return err;
00348 }
00349 
00350 static inline int xnarch_release_irq (unsigned irq) {
00351 
00352     return rthal_release_irq(irq);
00353 }
00354 
00355 static inline int xnarch_enable_irq (unsigned irq)
00356 
00357 {
00358     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00359         return -EINVAL;
00360 
00361     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00362 
00363     return 0;
00364 }
00365 
00366 static inline int xnarch_disable_irq (unsigned irq)
00367 
00368 {
00369     if (irq >= XNARCH_IRQ_MAX)
00370         return -EINVAL;
00371 
00372     rthal_disable_irq(irq);
00373 
00374     return 0;
00375 }
00376 
00377 static inline void xnarch_isr_chain_irq (unsigned irq) {
00378     rthal_pend_linux_irq(irq);
00379 }
00380 
00381 static inline void xnarch_isr_enable_irq (unsigned irq) {
00382     rthal_enable_irq(irq);
00383 }
00384 
00385 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void) {
00386 
00387     rthal_pend_linux_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00388 }

00391                                                  cpumask_t affinity) {

00400

00402 
00403 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00404 
00405 {
00406 #if  CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00407     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00408 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00409     /* Compute the time needed to program the decrementer in aperiodic
00410        mode. The return value is expressed in timebase ticks. */
00411     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_calibrate_timer());
00412 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00413 }
00414 
00415 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00416                                       void (*tickhandler)(void)) {
00417     return rthal_request_timer(tickhandler,ns);
00418 }
00419 
00420 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00421 
00422 {
00423     adeos_declare_cpuid;
00424 
00425     adeos_load_cpuid();
00426 
00427     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00428        and always inside a critical section. */
00429     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00430     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00431     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_get_current(cpuid);
00432     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00433 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00434     rootcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&rootcb->user_task->thread.fpr[0];
00435 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00436 }
00437 
00438 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb) {
00439     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00440 }
00441 
00442 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00443                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00444 {
00445     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00446     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00447     unsigned long flags;
00448 
00449     rthal_hw_lock(flags);
00450 
00451     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00452 
00453     if (inproc && inproc != outproc) /* User-space thread switch? */
00454         {
00455         struct mm_struct *prev = outproc->active_mm;
00456         struct mm_struct *next = inproc->active_mm;
00457 
00458         /* Switch the mm context.*/
00459 
00460         inproc->thread.pgdir = next->pgd;
00461 
00462         if (prev != next)
00463             {
00464             get_mmu_context(next);
00465             set_context(next->context, next->pgd);
00466             }
00467 
00468         if (!inproc->mm)
00469             enter_lazy_tlb(prev,inproc);
00470 
00471         /* The following has been lifted from
00472            arch/ppc/kernel/process.c. */
00473 
00474 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00475         if (outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00476             giveup_fpu(outproc);
00477 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00478         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_VEC)))
00479             giveup_altivec(outproc);
00480 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00481 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00482         if ((outproc->thread.regs && (outproc->thread.regs->msr & MSR_SPE)))
00483             giveup_spe(outproc);
00484 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00485 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00486 
00487 #ifdef CONFIG_ALTIVEC
00488         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_altivec == inproc)
00489             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_VEC;
00490 #endif /* CONFIG_ALTIVEC */
00491 
00492 #ifdef CONFIG_SPE
00493         if (inproc->thread.regs && last_task_used_spe == inproc)
00494             inproc->thread.regs->msr |= MSR_SPE;
00495 #endif /* CONFIG_SPE */
00496 
00497         _switch(&outproc->thread,&inproc->thread);
00498         }
00499     else
00500         /* Kernel-to-kernel context switch. */
00501         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb->kspp,in_tcb->kspp);
00502 
00503     rthal_hw_unlock(flags);
00504 }
00505 
00506 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00507                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb) {
00508     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00509 }
00510 
00511 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb) {
00512     /* Empty */
00513 }
00514 
00515 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00516                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00517                                          const char *name)
00518 {
00519     tcb->user_task = current;
00520     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00521     tcb->ksp = 0;
00522     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00523 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00524     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00525 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00526     tcb->entry = NULL;
00527     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00528     tcb->self = thread;
00529     tcb->imask = 0;
00530     tcb->name = name;
00531 }
00532 
00533 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb) {
00534 
00535     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00536     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00537     tcb->kspp = &tcb->ksp;
00538 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00539     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00540 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00541     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00542 }
00543 
00544 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00545 
00546 {
00547     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!tcb->imask);
00548     xnpod_welcome_thread(tcb->self);
00549     tcb->entry(tcb->cookie);
00550     xnpod_delete_thread(tcb->self);
00551 }
00552 
00553 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00554                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00555                                        void *cookie,
00556                                        int imask,
00557                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00558                                        char *name)
00559 {
00560     unsigned long *ksp, flags;
00561 
00562     adeos_hw_local_irq_flags(flags);
00563 
00564     *tcb->stackbase = 0;
00565     ksp = (unsigned long *)((((unsigned long)tcb->stackbase + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf) - RTHAL_SWITCH_FRAME_SIZE);
00566     tcb->ksp = (unsigned long)ksp - STACK_FRAME_OVERHEAD;
00567     ksp[19] = (unsigned long)tcb; /* r3 */
00568     ksp[25] = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_trampoline; /* lr */
00569     ksp[26] = flags & ~MSR_EE; /* msr */
00570 
00571     tcb->entry = entry;
00572     tcb->cookie = cookie;
00573     tcb->self = thread;
00574     tcb->imask = imask;
00575     tcb->name = name;
00576 }
00577 
00578 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00579 
00580 {
00581 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00582     /* Initialize the FPU for an emerging kernel-based RT thread. This
00583        must be run on behalf of the emerging thread. */
00584     memset(&tcb->fpuenv,0,sizeof(tcb->fpuenv));
00585     rthal_init_fpu(&tcb->fpuenv);
00586 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00587 }
00588 
00589 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00590 
00591 {
00592 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00593 
00594     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00595 
00596     if (task)
00597         {
00598         if (task->thread.regs && (task->thread.regs->msr & MSR_FP))
00599             giveup_fpu(task);
00600 
00601         return;
00602         }
00603 
00604     /* Save the fp regs of the kernel thread owning the FPU. */
00605 
00606     rthal_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00607 
00608 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00609 }
00610 
00611 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00612 
00613 {
00614 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00615 
00616     if (tcb->user_task)
00617         /* On PowerpPC, we let the unavailability exception happen for
00618            the incoming user-space task if it happens to use the FPU,
00619            instead of eagerly reloading the fp regs upon switch. */
00620         return;
00621 
00622     /* Restore the fp regs of the incoming kernel thread. */
00623 
00624     rthal_restore_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00625 
00626 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00627 }
00628 
00629 void xnarch_sleep_on (int *flagp) {
00630 
00631     while (!*flagp)
00632         {
00633         set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00634         schedule_timeout(1);
00635         }
00636 }
00637 
00638 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00639 
00640 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00641 
00642     return adeos_send_ipi(ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0, cpumask);
00643 }
00644 
00645 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void))
00646 
00647 {
00648     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00649                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00650                                      (void (*)(unsigned)) handler,
00651                                      NULL,
00652                                      IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00653 }
00654 
00655 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void)
00656 
00657 {
00658     return adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00659                                      ADEOS_SERVICE_IPI0,
00660                                      NULL,
00661                                      NULL,
00662                                      IPIPE_PASS_MASK);
00663 }
00664 
00665 static inline void xnarch_notify_halt(void)
00666 
00667 {
00668     unsigned long flags = adeos_critical_enter(NULL);
00669     adeos_critical_exit(flags);
00670 }
00671 
00672 #else /* !CONFIG_SMP */
00673 
00674 static inline int xnarch_send_ipi (cpumask_t cpumask) {
00675 
00676     return 0;
00677 }
00678 
00679 static inline int xnarch_hook_ipi (void (*handler)(void)) {
00680 
00681     return 0;
00682 }
00683 
00684 static inline int xnarch_release_ipi (void) {
00685 
00686     return 0;
00687 }
00688 
00689 #define xnarch_notify_halt() /* Nullified */
00690 
00691 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00692 
00693 static inline void xnarch_notify_shutdown(void)
00694 
00695 {
00696 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00697     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00698        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00699     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00700 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00701 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00702     xnshadow_release_events();
00703 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00704     /* Wait for the currently processed events to drain. */
00705     set_current_state(TASK_UNINTERRUPTIBLE);
00706     schedule_timeout(50);
00707     xnarch_release_ipi();
00708 }
00709 
00710 static inline int xnarch_escalate (void)
00711 
00712 {
00713     extern int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00714 
00715     if (adp_current == adp_root)
00716         {
00717         spl_t s;
00718         splsync(s);
00719         adeos_trigger_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00720         splexit(s);
00721         return 1;
00722         }
00723 
00724     return 0;
00725 }
00726 
00727 static void xnarch_notify_ready (void)
00728 
00729 {
00730 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00731     xnshadow_grab_events();
00732 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00733 }
00734 
00735 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */
00736 
00737 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00738 
00739 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00740                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00741                                            const char *name)
00742 {
00743     struct task_struct *task = current;
00744 
00745     tcb->user_task = task;
00746     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00747     tcb->ksp = 0;
00748     tcb->kspp = &task->thread.ksp;
00749 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00750     tcb->fpup = (rthal_fpenv_t *)&task->thread.fpr[0];
00751 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00752     tcb->entry = NULL;
00753     tcb->cookie = NULL;
00754     tcb->self = thread;
00755     tcb->imask = 0;
00756     tcb->name = name;
00757 }
00758 
00759 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00760 
00761 {
00762     unsigned irq;
00763 
00764     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00765         adeos_virtualize_irq(irq,
00766                              handler,
00767                              NULL,
00768                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00769 
00770     /* On this arch, the decrementer trap is not an external IRQ but
00771        it is instead mapped to a virtual IRQ, so we must grab it
00772        individually. */
00773 
00774     adeos_virtualize_irq(ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ,
00775                          handler,
00776                          NULL,
00777                          IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00778 }
00779 
00780 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00781 
00782 {
00783     unsigned irq;
00784 
00785     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00786         {
00787         switch (irq)
00788             {
00789 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00790             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00791 
00792                 /* Never lock out this one. */
00793                 continue;
00794 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00795 
00796             default:
00797 
00798                 __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00799             }
00800         }
00801 
00802     __adeos_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00803 }
00804 
00805 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00806 
00807 {
00808     unsigned irq;
00809 
00810     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00811         {
00812         switch (irq)
00813             {
00814 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00815             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_IPI:
00816 
00817                 continue;
00818 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00819 
00820             default:
00821 
00822                 __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00823             }
00824         }
00825 
00826     __adeos_unlock_irq(adp,ADEOS_TIMER_VIRQ);
00827 }
00828 
00829 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00830 
00831 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00832 
00833 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long long delay) {
00834     /* Delays are expressed in CPU ticks, so we need to keep a 64bit
00835        value here, especially for 64bit arch ports using an interval
00836        timer based on the internal cycle counter of the CPU. Since the
00837        timebase value is used to express CPU ticks on the PowerPC
00838        port, there is no need to rescale the delay value. */ 
00839     rthal_set_timer_shot(delay);
00840 }
00841 
00842 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void) {
00843     rthal_release_timer();
00844 }
00845 
00846 static inline void xnarch_read_timings (unsigned long long *shot,
00847                                         unsigned long long *delivery,
00848                                         unsigned long long defval)
00849 {
00850 #ifdef CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING
00851     int cpuid = adeos_processor_id();
00852     *shot = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_handled;
00853     *delivery = __adeos_profile_data[cpuid].irqs[__adeos_tick_irq].t_synced;
00854 #else /* !CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00855     *shot = defval;
00856     *delivery = defval;
00857 #endif /* CONFIG_ADEOS_PROFILING */
00858 }
00859 
00860 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00861 
00862 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00863 
00864 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00865 
00866 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00867 
00868 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00869 
00870 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00871 
00872 static int xnarch_trap_fault (adevinfo_t *evinfo)
00873 
00874 {
00875     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00876     fltinfo.regs = (struct pt_regs *)evinfo->evdata;
00877     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00878 }
00879 
00880 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00881 
00882 {
00883     int err = 0;
00884 
00885 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00886     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00887        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00888     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00889 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00890 
00891     xnarch_escalation_virq = adeos_alloc_irq();
00892 
00893     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00894         return -ENOSYS;
00895 
00896     adeos_virtualize_irq_from(&rthal_domain,
00897                               xnarch_escalation_virq,
00898                               (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00899                               NULL,
00900                               IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00901 
00902     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_set_trap_handler(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00903 
00904 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00905     err = xnshadow_mount();
00906 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00907 
00908     if (err)
00909         adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00910 
00911     return err;
00912 }
00913 
00914 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00915 
00916 {
00917 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00918     xnshadow_cleanup();
00919 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00920     rthal_set_trap_handler(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00921     adeos_free_irq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00922 }
00923 
00924 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00925 
00926 #ifdef __cplusplus
00927 }
00928 #endif

00934 #define xnarch_delete_display(obj)
00935 #define xnarch_post_graph(obj,state)
00936 #define xnarch_post_graph_if(obj,state,cond)
